translated: The Chapter on the Conditions🔽The Chapter on the Conditions in Triads

original: Dhammānulomapaccanīya (3), Tikadukapaṭṭhānapāḷi (4)🔽16.30. Vitakkattika, Hetuduka🔽Savitakkasavicāraṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nasavitakkasavicāro nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā pannarasa …pe… avigate pannarasa.🔽Savitakkasavicāraṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naavitakkavicāramatto nanahetu dhammo
analyzed: dhamma anuloma paccanīya tika duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi  vitakkattika hetuduka  sa vitakka sa vicāram hetum dhammam paṭicca na sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā pannarasa pe avigate pannarasa  sa vitakka sa vicāram na hetum dhammam paṭicca na a vitakka vicāra mattaḥ na na hetu dhammo
translated: The Chapter on the Conditions in Dyads🔽With applied thought and sustained thought, a condition being a cause, there is an uncaused state without applied thought and sustained thought. (In brief.) With a cause, fifteen; … without ignorance, fifteen.

original: uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā aṭṭhavīsa, ārammaṇe aṭṭhavīsa, adhipatiyā
analyzed: uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā aṭṭhavīsa ārammaṇe aṭṭhavīsa adhipatiyā
translated: With applied thought and sustained thought, a condition being not a cause, there is a state without applied thought and with sustained thought only, not a cause. (In brief.) With a cause, twenty-eight; with object, twenty-eight; with predominance,

original: ekūnavīsa …pe… purejāte āsevane ekūnavīsa …pe… avigate aṭṭhavīsa.
analyzed: ekūnavīsa pe purejāte āsevane ekūnavīsa pe avigate aṭṭhavīsa
translated: twenty-one; … with prior conditionality, with subsequent conditionality, twenty-one; … with absence, twenty-eight.
